definitions.definition: In a way characterized by addition (of increments ) rather than multiplication (by factors ) or exponentiation (by exponents ): by an arithmetic progression .
examples: Over the past decade the business has grown arithmetically , which shows that it is serving a demand successfully; but because it has not grown exponentially, its growth is viewed by some investors as "not good enough."
labels: of the nature of increases or decreases
definitions.label_groups: of the nature of increases or decreases

examples: The two terms are arithmetically equivalent, but they are not equally intuitive regarding what phenomenon they represent in the real world.

main_definition: ( of the nature of increases or decreases ) In a way characterized by addition (of increments ) rather than multiplication (by factors ) or exponentiation (by exponents ): by an arithmetic progression .
